name: Ggitflow-maven-plugin
tagline: Gitflow Maven Plugin that provides the Gitflow branching model with Maven versioning
body:
# Gitflow Maven Plugin
`gitflow-maven-plugin` provides Maven support for Vincent Driessen's branching model http://nvie.com/posts/a-successful-git-branching-model/.

Think of `gitflow-maven-plugin` as the `maven-release-plugin` for the Gitflow branching model.

The plugin uses [GGitflow](http://dkirrane.github.io/ggitflow/), therefore it uses the git console directly under the hood rather than JGit.

# Maven settings
Add the following to your Maven `settings.xml`
```xml
<pluginGroups>
   <pluginGroup>com.dkirrane.maven.plugins</pluginGroup>
</pluginGroups>
```

# Credentials
For Git https connections a `git credential.helper` or a `netrc` file allows you to permanently store the repo credentials to use when you clone, pull, push or fetch. Note, the `netrc` file does require you to store your passwords in plain text.

### Windows
* Store your Git credentials with [git credential.helper](https://help.github.com/articles/caching-your-github-password-in-git/)
_**or**_
* Create a text file called `_netrc` in your home directory (`%USERPROFILE%/_netrc`). 
* Add credentials to the file for the Git server in the same format as described below.

### Linux or OSX
* Store your Git credentials with [git credential.helper](https://help.github.com/articles/caching-your-github-password-in-git/#platform-linux)
_**or**_
* Create a file called `.netrc` in your home directory (`~/.netrc`).
* Add credentials to the file for the Git server in the same format as described below.
* `chmod 600 ~/.netrc`

### Sample netrc file
```
machine github.com
login myusername
password mypassword

machine api.github.com
login myusername
password mypassword
```

# Goals
[Plugin Documentation](http://dkirrane.github.io/ggitflow-maven-plugin/plugin-info.html)

## Sample POM configuration
Add the following to your top-level parent aggregator POM.
```xml 
<plugin>
    <groupId>com.dkirrane.maven.plugins</groupId>
    <artifactId>ggitflow-maven-plugin</artifactId>
    <version>3.0</version>
    <configuration>
        <!-- Optional Config For all parameters see: -->
        <!-- http://dkirrane.github.io/ggitflow-maven-plugin/plugin-info.html -->
        <!--
        <prefixes>
            <masterBranch>master</masterBranch>
            <developBranch>development</developBranch>
            <featureBranchPrefix>feature/</featureBranchPrefix>
            <releaseBranchPrefix>release/</releaseBranchPrefix>
            <hotfixBranchPrefix>hotfix/</hotfixBranchPrefix>
            <supportBranchPrefix>support/</supportBranchPrefix>
            <versionTagPrefix>v-</versionTagPrefix>
        </prefixes>
        <msgPrefix>[ggitflow-maven-plugin]</msgPrefix>
        <msgSuffix>+review @reviewer123</msgSuffix>
        <enableFeatureVersions>true</enableFeatureVersions>
        <releaseProfiles>my-profile1, my-profile2</releaseProfiles>
        -->
    </configuration>
</plugin>
```

***
   
   

:no_entry: Note for Windows users
`ggitflow-maven-plugin` uses the git console therefore the below Maven commands must be run from a git terminal like Git BASH [Git for Windows](https://git-for-windows.github.io/)

### Start & Finish a Feature branch
```bash
mvn gitflow:feature-start
mvn gitflow:feature-finish
```

### Start & Finish a Release branch
```bash
mvn gitflow:release-start
mvn gitflow:release-finish
```

### Start & Finish a Hotfix branch
```bash
mvn gitflow:hotfix-start
mvn gitflow:hotfix-finish
```

### Start a Support branch
```bash
mvn gitflow:support-start
```

### Tag a Support branch
```bash
mvn gitflow:tag
```

### Repository
Snapshots of this plugin can be downloaded from [Sonatype OSS](https://oss.sonatype.org/).
Simply add the following to your pom.
```xml
<pluginRepositories>
    <pluginRepository>
        <id>sonatype</id>
        <url>https://oss.sonatype.org/content/groups/public</url>
    </pluginRepository>
</pluginRepositories>
```
